content.match_overview: Bournemouth (8th, 49pts) host Manchester United (14th, 38pts) in a Premier League clash between teams seeking momentum. Both sides have lost 50% of their last six matches [2][3], with Bournemouth's +12 goal differential contrasting sharply with United's -8 [3]. The Cherries won 3-0 in December's reverse fixture [6], part of a three-match unbeaten run against United [3]. Bournemouth's home xG differential of +9.7 ranks top-six in the league [7], while United's away xG differential places them among relegation-threatened sides [6].

team_news.raw: Bournemouth retain their first-choice XI with Evanilson leading the line. United miss Matthijs de Ligt (ankle) until May [5], forcing Maguire to anchor a three-man defense. Marcus Rashford remains absent from United's attacking options [5].

home.projected_xi: Arrizabalaga; Smith, Zabarnyi, Huijsen, Kerkez; Cook, Adams; Semenyo, Kluivert, Tavernier; Evanilson

away.projected_xi: Onana; Dalot, Maguire, Yoro, Mazraoui; Ugarte, Casemiro; Dorgu, Fernandes, Garnacho; Hojlund

asian_handicap_analysis.analysis: Bournemouth's -0.75 line at 1.91 offers value given their +9.7 home xGDiff [7] vs United's -8 away GD [3]. The Cherries have covered this handicap in 2 of 3 recent H2Hs [3], while United failed to cover in 4/5 away games vs top-half teams [6].
asian_handicap_analysis.raw: The market undervalues Bournemouth's 2.34 post-shot xG in December's fixture [6]. United's defense allows 1.39 goals/game away [3], struggling against direct wingers like Semenyo (1.2 key passes/90) [7].

key_player_matchups.title: Antoine Semenyo vs Harry Maguire
key_player_matchups.content: Semenyo (1.2 key passes/90 [7]) targets Maguire's 1.5 fouls/90 [3]. United's captain wins only 58% of aerial duels [3], vulnerable to Bournemouth's league-high 18 crosses/90 [7].
key_player_matchups.raw: Semenyo created 3 chances in December's fixture [3], exploiting Maguire's lack of mobility.

key_player_matchups.title: Bruno Fernandes vs Lewis Cook
key_player_matchups.content: Fernandes (2.3 key passes/90 [3]) faces Cook's 2.1 interceptions/90 [7]. Bournemouth's midfielder allows just 0.8 dribbles/90 [7], crucial against United's 54% possession rate [1].
key_player_matchups.raw: Cook nullified Fernandes in December's match, limiting him to 0.6 xGChain [1].

betting_insights.raw: Our model shows 58% probability for Bournemouth covering -0.75 (fair odds 1.72) vs bookmakers' 1.91

betting_insights.insight: Over 2.5 @ 1.70 (65% historical hit rate in H2Hs [3])
betting_insights.raw: Last 3 H2Hs averaged 3.6 goals [3], with Bournemouth's home games seeing 58% Over 2.5 [7]
United score in 71% of away games [3], facing Bournemouth's 1.52 xGA/home [7]

prediction.reasoning: Bournemouth's superior xG (1.75 vs 1.15 [7]) and United's defensive vulnerabilities (1.39 GA/away [3]) suggest home win. United's 50% away loss rate [2] compounds issues.

my_say.content: At the Vitality Stadium, where Bournemouth have transformed from plucky underdogs to statistical powerhouses, Erik ten Hag's United face their latest identity crisis. The Cherries' 3-0 demolition at Old Trafford in December wasn't a fluke - it was a xG masterclass (2.34 vs 1.45 [6]) showcasing Iraola's pressing machine. Now, with Semenyo's jet-heeled runs targeting Maguire's turning circle and Fernandes trying to solve Cook's midfield puzzle, this clash pits process against pedigree. United's European distractions [5] meet Bournemouth's algorithmic ambition - a modern football parable where expected goals meet unexpected drama.
